content: Aug 21 Sempra Energy said it will buy Oncor for $9.45 billion in cash after Energy Future Holdings Corp  which indirectly owns Oncor  abandoned a deal to sell the power transmission company to Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc.
name: Sempra Energy
title: UPDATE 1-Sempra Energy to buy Oncor for $9.45 bln in blow for Berkshire

content: Aug 21 Sempra Energy said it will buy power transmission company Oncor  80 percent owned by Energy Future Holdings Corp  for $9.45 billion in cash  resolving the Texas utility's long-standing bankruptcy case.
name: Sempra Energy
title: Sempra Energy to buy Oncor for $9.45 bln in cash

content: LIMA  Nov 18 Peru is considering rescinding Odebrecht SA's $5 billion natural gas pipeline contract after the Brazilian company's attempt to sell its majority stake in the project got snagged on corruption concerns  a government source said Friday.
name: Sempra Energy
title: Peru considers rescinding Odebrecht's pipeline contract -source

title: Sempra quits talks on Odebrecht Peru pipeline  partners scramble

content: WASHINGTON  April 1 A new U.S. government task force will look into the country's biggest ever accidental release of methane  which occurred over several months in Los Angeles  California  hoping to prevent future leaks of the potent greenhouse gas from storage wells  the Obama administration said on Friday.
name: Sempra Energy
title: U.S. task force to look at massive California natural gas leak

title: Gas company to be arraigned over Los Angeles area methane leak

title: IEnova to buy Pemex stake in pipeline joint venture for $1.325 billion

content: LOS ANGELES  July 2 Fifteen years ago  California led the way to cleaner transit buses with strict tailpipe emissions standards that effectively ushered out diesel as the primary fuel for buses in the state and replaced it with natural gas.
name: Sempra Energy
title: RPT-INSIGHT-California's push for cleaner buses could edge out natural gas

content: NEW YORK  March 20 Castleton Commodities International LLC  a privately held U.S. energy merchant  has hired Peter Sellars  former metals chief at JPMorgan Chase & Co and Sempra  as part of its launch into the global physical base metals market  it said on Friday.
